definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
abbr. for Egypt 埃及[Ai1 ji2]
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: Ship which is in best condition according to Lloyd's register.
sentences.chinese: 按勞埃德船級社登記本是最佳狀態的船舶。

sentences.english: Timms said the bank had a "good commercial future".
sentences.chinese: 提姆斯說勞埃德有着“美好的商業未來”。

sentences.english: She really should have insisted on Lloyd putting down weather stripping.
sentences.chinese: 她覺得自己真應該堅持讓勞埃德把門裝上密封條。

sentences.english: Tepper said he believed that Lloyds would ultimately emerge in a healthy condition.
sentences.chinese: 太普說，他認爲勞埃德最終將出現在一個健康的狀態。

sentences.english: Loyd came a cropper on his bicycle and broke his leg.
sentences.chinese: 勞埃德騎車栽了跟頭，把腿摔斷了。

sentences.english: As the two women talk, Codi's high school relationship with Loyd Peregrina is revealed.
sentences.chinese: 由於兩名婦女交談，編碼高中與勞埃德蠅顯示。

sentences.english: Falling behind quickly was Lloyd and Mikey, her husband and her son.
sentences.chinese: 快速地落在車後的是勞埃德和麥克，他的丈夫和兒子。
